Password Boss always uses bank-grade, 256-bit encryption. Your info is stored locally, and only you can access it using your master password.

Password Boss does not store your Master Password. If you forget your Master Password, there is no way to recover it.

We found an existing account with that email address. You can log into the existing account or create a new account with a different email address.

Your Master Password is your key to unlocking all of the data you have stored in Password Boss. Choose a strong password that you will not forget. If you lose your Master Password, Password Boss cannot recover or reset it.

Please fill in one of the required fields.
Create one master password that \n logs you into sites with all of your \n unique usernames and passwords.

Your master password is your key to unlocking your information stored in Password Boss. The master password is never stored or transmitted to Password Boss, nor can we reset or change it for you. Please visit our support site for information on the master password.

If you have changed your master password in the last 2 weeks we may be able to restore your Password Boss account to a previous version that uses your previous master password. You will need a verification code to complete the process. Log into your Password Boss Portal Account to request a code.
Enter the security code we sent to you via email

Your Password Boss account has been restored to a previous version that uses your previous Master Password. In a few minutes you will be able to log in to Password Boss using your previous Master Password.
Your form data will not be saved.
An error occurred while saving data.

Your installation of Password Boss-the leading password manager and digital wallet-is complete. Get one-click logins, automatic form filling, bank-grade encryption, secure sharing, and more-without slowing down your PC.

Your Master Password is your key to unlocking all of the data you have stored in Password Boss. Choose a strong password that you will not forget. If you lose your Master Password, Password Boss cannot recover or reset it.
We ask for your mobile phone number to allow us to verify your identity for certain account activities. Please note that we will not sell or distribute your number to any third-party.

Password Boss has imported passwords that were insecurely stored in your browsers, and disabled password saving to improve your online security. Now you can use Password Boss to login to all of your accounts.

By tapping Create Account, I accept the Password Boss Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
As a last resort, you can use this one-time code to disable 2-Step Verification and to log into your Password Boss account. Do not lose this code.
From now on when you log into your Password Boss account you will need to enter a security code from your mobile device.

2-Step Verification adds an extra layer of security to your account. \nWhenever you sign into the Password Boss app you will need to enter both your Master Password and also a security code sent to your mobile phone.
For security, please enter your Master Password.
If you lose the mobile device your authenticator app is installed on, we can send a security code to your backup mobile device that will allow you to disable 2-Step Verification.
Include country code and complete mobile number
Enter the security code generated by your mobile authenticator app
Authenticator apps let you generate security codes on your phone. We support these
To configure your authenticator app you can either:
Use your authenticator app to scan the barcode below,
Manually enter the secret key into your authenticator app.

Use Password Boss to create strong passwords. Set the length of the password and the combination of letters, numbers, symbols and capitals. When you are done, click \'Create\' to make a new password.

The latest version of Password Boss is ready to install. This is required update. Password Boss will not function until it is updated.

Password Boss has already saved a password for this site. Would you like to update it?

Two-step verification adds an extra layer of security to your account. Whenever your sign into the Password Boss app you will need to enter both your Master Password and also a security code sent to your mobile phone.
Add the following items to Password Boss and have Password Boss automatically fill in these items for you next time. After adding new items, the items can be edited in the main application.

Enabling PIN code or Touch ID in Password Boss will securely store an encrypted copy of your Master Password on your device. You will occasionally still be prompted for your Master Password to ensure the security of your account.

Your Master Password is used to encrypt all of your data in Password Boss. Only you know this password and it is never stored in Password Boss. Choose a Master Password that is difficult to guess and that you will not forget.

Enter the email address for your emergency contact

Your emergency contact will have to wait for the period of time that you specify below before they can access your Password Boss account. During this waiting period you can decline their request to access your Password Boss account.

Choose items to give emergency access to

Select the items in your Password Boss account that your emergency contact will have access to. Choose the \"Default\" button below to give your emergency contact access to all of the items in your Password Boss account.

Welcome to your Security Report Card!
Below is your score, overall results and steps to improve your security.
Use the steps below to improve the security of your accounts.
Remove any passwords that are insecurely stored in your browsers.
Turn off password saving in your browsers for added security.
You can disable Password Boss on the current page or the entire site
What would you like to do?
Save your login for this site?
Add to Password Boss and fill in this information automatically?
Welcome to the Password Boss guided tour!
This is where you store your usernames, passwords and other important information. To help you get started we\'ve put together a guided tour. Would you like to begin?
Your passwords and stored items are here.
All of the logins for your accounts and your other information like addresses and personal info are stored in these categories.
This is how to organize your items
Use folders and sub-folders to organize your items any way that makes sense to you.
This is how to add items
In addition to usernames and passwords, you can add over 25 different types of items to keep all of your important information in one secure place.
Here\'s how to share your items
You can share individual items, or entire folders of items, with anyone you choose.
This is how to enable Emergency Access
Here\'s how to check your security score
Find your old, weak and duplicate passwords so you can update the passwords with unique and hard to crack passwords.
You can start the tour at anytime from the Tools menu.
Deleting a folder will also delete all items in the folder, as well as subfolders and items in subfolders.
Are you sure you want to delete the folder?
Are you sure you want to remove your emergency contact? Once removed your emergency contact will not have emergency access to your Password Boss account.

Your emergency contact has requested access to your Password Boss account. Do you want to approve or deny the request? If you do nothing your emergency contact will receive access after the waiting period has expired.
The access request from your emergency contact has been denied. Your emergency contact will no longer have emergency access to your Password Boss account.
Do you want to resend the invitation?
How long should the items be shared?
Emergency contacts with current access to your account
Click on the logos to save your username and password for each site

Folder list is empty. Click the \"+\" to add a new folder.
